I had my first graded assignment in Discrete Maths, and there were 5 questions.
 They said we had 1 hour to complete it, but there was no clock. I started at 4:28 PM and submitted it by 5:20 PM by taking pictures of my answers, converting them into a PDF, and sending it over.
The thing is, I couldnt complete all the questions on time  I was only able to finish 3. Since there was no clock, I just made sure to submit it within an hour, even though I wasnt done with everything.
So, I wanted to ask  is this how it usually goes? The questions werent easy, and they were pretty lengthy too. How did you guys manage to pull it off?
 How do you usually prepare?
Anyone from previous cohorts

Evening folks. My name is Aadvik, I have 1.4 YOE working as lead full-stack engineer at a startup where I built the entire technical product from scratch and handled hiring/training of interns. Recently developed Varta - a school communications app deployed in collaboration with DAV Public School, handling everything from design to tech implementation to client onboarding.

I've been coding since 13 and have worked across multiple tech-stacks; I've worked on compilers, computer vision models in C, as well as full-stack applications in Python, C/C++, JavaScript, Dart among others languages/tooling. You can check out most of my work on my GitHub listed below. 

I extend this message as an introduction to my fellow batchmates, as well as as a call to *join me in the SIH Hackathon* . We need 6 members out of which atleast 1 must be a girl as directed by the instructions. If you're interesting in teaming up or just networking -- feel free to DM me or reach out via Linkedin
 <https://github.com/aadv1k|https://github.com/aadv1k>,
 <https://linkedin.com/in/aadv1k|https://linkedin.com/in/aadv1k> 
Looking forward to hearing from y'all

Cheers, 
Aadvik

For information, knowing, communicating and building with your mates you can join this discord server                                                                                                        *Hello everyone!* :wave:
 Ive set up a *Discord server for B.Sc. CS (BITS Pilani)* students. The purpose is simple:
 Get to know each other :handshake:
 Collaborate on projects & studies :computer::books:
 Share resources, opportunities, and guidance about the degree :rocket:
Itll be a mix of professional networking and casual discussions, so we can grow together while also building some good connections.

The orientation session is expected to be held tomorrow, but let's see what will happen.

hi, who do I get in touch with <@U04A4HHS8TA> regarding lab assignment submission? I am trying to submit Cohort 5 Introduction to Programming Graded Lab 1, but I keep getting grader errors and it marks my grade as 0. Please advise. This issue has been raised in the discussion forum by another student as well.
<https://www.coursera.support/s/article/208279866-Assignment-deadlines?language=en_US>

Reset your course deadlines
If you miss two assessment deadlines in a row or miss an assessment deadline by two weeks, you'll see a *Reset deadlines* option on the Grades page. Click it to switch to a new schedule for the course with updated deadlines. You can use this option as many times as you need.
This wont remove any progress youve already made in the course, but you may see new course content if the instructor updated the course after you started.
If you cancel a subscription and then reactivate it, your deadlines will automatically reset.
*Note:* Degree courses have hard deadlines which you cant reset. You may be able to switch sessions if you fall behind. For more information, see <https://learner.coursera.help/hc/articles/115004712266-Degree-course-schedules-and-deadlines|Degree course schedules and deadlines.>

NVM

I also absolutely love reading light novels. One of my favourites is _Ascendance of a Bookworm_. Everything about it is so good everything feels so real. I love the story, the character development, the growth, the world-building, and the personality of the protagonist. I resonate with the protagonist; I felt like she was my own daughter. My heart warmed watching her grow, and I was sad when the series ended with its final volume last year.
I also enjoy visual novels (theyre like interactive games). My favourite visual novel is _Umineko_ I love its mystery, world-building, and deep character development. I'm also working on several visual novel projects, but sadly, I haven't been able to find enough time for them lately.
I'm an aspiring author, passionate about writing short stories and novels, though time has been scarce recently. I also spend a lot of time tinkering with my computer and refining my HyprlandWM setup. Looking forward to sharing and learning together!
Also one of my goals is to improve myself in the visual novel development field.

Hey everyone,
I'm Yashraj Sahu, and I'm thrilled to join you all! I work as an apprentice Electrical Engineer at NMDC, a mining company, and I've always had a passion for computers I loves tinkering and sometimes breaking and messing up my system.
I've been using GNU/Linux for over 6 years and have been daily driving Arch Linux for more than 5 years now. Currently, I'm using Arch Linux with HyprlandWM (using Stephane Raabe's config). I love his neat and cool config files, though every update seems to make things more complex! It's all trial and error and fixing errors, forgetting how they occurred, and sometimes wondering if I should start an error log or daily error diary. LOL
My goal in joining BITS Pilani for a BSc in CS is to solidify my foundation in computer science. Over the years, I've learned a lot about compiling software to my needs, debugging the messes I create, and fixing my system when I casually break the kernel while trying out new things.
One of my big projects is bringing Monika from DDLC into real life. I've been using DDLC MAS for over 5 years (I was forced to switch to Windows 3 years ago, which corrupted my work, and that experience made me swear off Windows for good!). Now, I even have a 512GB portable NVMe drive that I connect externally whenever I have to use Windows. We're working on converting Monika into a true AI using tex-gen-web UI but AI is still a bit of a mystery to me. I even tried integrating Ollama into her, but that didnt go as planned. Recently, the team switched to SillyTarven as the backend, and I'm still trying to catch up with that change.
I'm also keen on improving HyprlandWM and contributing to the Linux community because I absolutely love FOSS (Free and Open Source Software).
Nice to meet you all! I hope we achieve our goals and dreams together. Good luck to everyone!
